entry.title: Don't Ever Use This Listed Password
entry.content: Really, people still use 123456 as their password in 2014? sigh

entry.title: How Apple keeps AirDrop files private and secure | iMore
entry.content:
Rene Ritchie di iMore: > ## Encrypted identities

When AirDrop is turned on, a 2048-bit RSA Identity is created and stored on your iPhone, iPad, or Mac. A hash, based on the phone numbers and/or email addresses associated with your Apple ID, is also created. Thatâ€™ll be used later to identify you in a way that maintains your privacy and security.

Security! Security!
